intro: Pilosella galiciana, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flowers that resemble a mouse's ears. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, and it produces numerous small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella galiciana is often found in meadows and open areas at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
